newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-NEWCASTLE SIGN BLACKBURN GOALKEEPER GIVEN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-NEWCASTLE SIGN BLACKBURN GOALKEEPER GIVEN.

text.p: Newcastle United signed Blackburn Rovers goalkeeper Shay Given on Friday and will now test whether they have to pay their English premier league rivals a transfer fee.
Ireland international Given has accepted a four-year deal. His contract with Blackburn expires at the end of June.
An independent tribunal will settle the transfer fee as the two clubs failed to agree on a sum.
Newcastle plan to seek clarification on payment for out of contract players involved in domestic transfers.

"Following the European Court of Justice ruling in the Bosman case, the requirement for the payment of a compensation fee at the end of a player's contract may be unlawful where the player moves between two British clubs," Newcastle said in a statement.
"NUFC proposes to raise this issue before the independent tribunal," it added.
In a ruling in December 1995, the European Court of Justice upheld the right of players to move to other clubs within the European Union on free transfers once their contracts expire.
The legal implications for transfers between two British clubs have yet to be fully established.
